before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"57v21","text":"Please follow the cleaning regime in a clean lab before sampling. If a clean lab in not available, wipe down all possible surfaces with 10% bleach solution to create a sterile work area.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"28kis","text":"This is a protocol to collect marine environmental DNA samples from remote rocky intertidal sites by filtering on-site using Sterivex filtering units and a syringe/sealant gun approach. By the end of this protocol, the user will have self-contained and preserved samples in sterviex filters ready for DNA extraction. This protocol has been developed using multiple sources (see references for details). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
image_attribution: All photos were taken and edited by Dina-Leigh Simons.

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"346q9","text":"Submerge 1L Nalgene bottles in 20% bleach solution (see solution preparation below) for at least 10-minutes. Be sure to completely expose all surfaces to bleach. If excessive dirt present, scrub with soap and water before submerging in bleach. If previous labelling is present on bottles, use ethanol to wipe off.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d3jbk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"abgol","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":289},{"key":1,"length":1,"offset":301},{"key":2,"length":1,"offset":332},{"key":3,"length":1,"offset":345},{"key":4,"length":1,"offset":358},{"key":5,"length":1,"offset":389}],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":29,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"8on7t","text":"Bleach solution preparation: If large amounts of deionised water is not available, which is often the case in remote locations, diluting bleach with tap water is suitable as long as it is used immediately. For a 0.5% active chlorine solution, use 25x dilution of 13% active chlorine (i.e.  solution =   13% active chlorine bleach +   tap water;   solution =   13% active chlorine bleach +   tap water).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"1":{"data":{"amount":"200","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"2":{"data":{"amount":"4800","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"3":{"data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"4":{"data":{"amount":"400","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"},"5":{"data":{"amount":"9600","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cjdqp","text":"Remove 1L Nalgene bottles from bleach and rinse (inside and outside) with deionised water (fill 1/3 of bottle, cap lid, shake, discard water on inside, rinse; repeat 3 times).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85vsm","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ord","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"length":1,"offset":149}],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f839k","text":"Deionised water must be transported with other equipment prior to arrival at sampling location when a source is not available at site. Approximately   of deionised water is required per wash of 20x Nalgene bottles. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{"0":{"data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3},"mutability":"MUTABLE","type":"amount"}}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5tre0","text":"Thoroughly dry 1L Nalgene bottles with clean blue roll or air dry on blue roll. Place into separate plastic bag/sterile box for transport to site.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d5rgf","text":"For all other field equipment (e.g. boxes, sealant guns, consumables), wipe down all surfaces with 10% bleach using blue roll.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3l65j","text":"Put on lab coat and clean non-powdered gloves. Wipe down work area with 10% bleach. If excess dirt is present, scrub surfaces with soap and water before bleaching.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"37nkj","text":"Count and pack consumables into field box, accounting for the number of desired samples and one negative field control per site. Add one extra set of all consumables to account for breakages, contamination, or unexpected sampling opportunities. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jtq8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"85hs5","text":"Sensitive consumables (sterivex filters, syringes, combistoppers, and ethanol) should be stored in a secondary smaller box. For ethanol, use a fresh aliquot for each site to minimise contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8f8k0","text":" {"blocks":[{"key":"286fb","text":"Transport all equipment in clean plastic bags within field bags (e.g. heavy duty holdall or similar) or sterile boxes to reduce contamination in transit. Avoid supplies from touching the transport bag directly. Use plastic bags to secure waste later. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1sv09","text":"Purchase sealed bottled drinking water on route to the site for a negative field control. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqhv5","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4v1kj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"51iju","text":"If accessible, use deionised water instead for the negative field control. If you are interested in microorganisms, bottled drinking water will not be sufficiently sterile as a control. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5352c","text":"Find an accessible and safe route onto the shore, carrying the bag with 1L Nalgene bottles and field box containing consumables. Find a suitable location to set-up a work station either on the shore or near the car.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
